titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Allegra Woodworth (1902-1974) received her bachelor's, master's, and doctoral degrees from Bryn Mawr College. She was a scholar in Tudor history and the author of Purveyance in the Royal Household of Queen Elizabeth. Woodworth was the Head of the History Department at The Shipley School from 1927 to 1971.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of research notes and photocopies of original manuscripts related to two of Woodworth's areas of research: Purveyance for the Royal Household of Queen Elizabeth, which was published in the Transactions of the American Philosophical Society in 1945; and a work in progress on William Fleetwood, Sergeant-at-law, and Recorder of London from 1571-1593. The collection also includes a printed copy of Purveyance and a folder of obituaries.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Mary Katharine Woodworth papers.
